snippet: Stock volumes have dwindled since the financial crisis, and some fear that investors wary of stocks may have trouble generating respectable returns from the ultralow interest rates of the bond market.
abstract: Volume of stock trading in the United States has failed to recover since the 2008 financial crisis and has continued to fall; decline stands in marked contrast to 1987 and 2001, when Americans regained their taste for stock trading within two years of economic shocks.
lead_paragraph: Stock volumes have dwindled since the financial crisis, and some fear that investors wary of stocks may have trouble generating respectable returns from the ultralow interest rates of the bond market.

headline.seo: Stock Trading Remains in a Slide After ’08 Crisis
headline.main: Stock Trading Is Still Falling After ’08 Crisis
headline.print_headline: Stock Trading Is Still Falling After ’08 Crisis
